sections.purpose: To provide rapid and thorough drying of laboratory glassware after washing.
sections.scope: Applicable to glassware maintenance in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Ensure glassware is thoroughly rinsed with distilled water before drying.
Place glassware onto the dryer pegs or inside the drying chamber.
Arrange items so that air can circulate freely inside and around them.
Switch ON the power and set the desired temperature (typically 60-80Â°C).
Start the timer if the unit is equipped with one.
Once dried, turn OFF the heater and allow glassware to cool slightly.
Remove glassware using heat-resistant gloves if necessary.
Wipe down the interior of the dryer weekly to remove dust.
precautions: Do not place plastic items or volumetric glassware (like pipettes) at high temperatures.
Ensure glassware is not dripping excessively before loading.
Do not overload the dryer as it reduces efficiency.
Check the electrical cord for any damage before use.
Avoid placing flammable solvents near the dryer unit.
